papers.title: Toward Full-Color Electroluminescent Quantum Dot Displays
papers.abstract_snippet: Colloidal quantum dots (QDs) exhibit unique characteristics such as facile color tunability, pure color emission with extremely narrow bandwidths, high luminescence efficiency, and high photostability. In addition, quantum dot light-emitting diodes (QLEDs) feature bright electroluminescence, low turn-on voltage, and ultrathin form factor, making them a promising candidate for next-generation displays. To achieve the overarching goal of the full-color display based on the electroluminescence of QDs, however it is essential to enhance the performance of QLEDs further for each color (e.g., red, green, and blue; RGB) and develop novel techniques for patterning RGB QD pixels without cross-contamination. Here, we present state-of-the-art material, process, and device technologies for full-color QLED-based displays.
papers.relevance_explanation_from_llm: This paper directly addresses quantum dot display technology by exploring electroluminescent QLED architectures, material developments, and patterning techniques required for full-color implementations - core aspects of next-generation display systems.
